Jīvaṁ-jīvaka，（m．onom．） name of a bird，a sort of pheasant （or partridge?），which utters a note sounding like jīvaṁ jīva D．III，201； J．V，406，416； VI，276，538 [Fausböll reads jīvajīvaka in all the Jātaka passages．Speyer AvŚ II．227 has jīvañjīvaka]．With this cp．the Jain phrase jīvaṁjīveṇa gacchaï jīvaṁjīveṇaṁ ciṭṭhaï，Weber Bhagavatī pp．289，290，with doubtful interpretation （“living he goes with life”? or “he goes like the j．bird”?）．（Page 285）
